item.title: Piling up of dumped rubbish in Fletching Road SE7, 11th January
item.description:
Londis have been allowed to keep their overflowing RBG palladin bin on the street for days attracting more fly-tipping every day. It is an eyesore and environmental health hazard. A breach of the Highways Act and EPA.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Village, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not wy, 11th January
item.description:
Vincennes Estate lighting. Burtwell Lane at the Clive Road entrance. Light mounted on the side wall of 27 Clive Road has not been working since mid November. I’ve reported twice before and it is still not been repaired. The walkway is extremely dark and feels very unsafe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Burtwell Lane, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal camping, 11th January
item.description:
There was one tent with what i believe to be a homeless man in and it has been left so long that now there are two tents.this is worrying as they are camped right by the fence looking into the secondary school playground.the tents are just as you go to the back of the asda carpark on the bit of green in between that and bexleyheath academy and also very near to a childrens playground.i think this is also a safeguarding issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Graham Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pallets and commercial waste blocking pedestrian pavement, 11th January
item.description:
Multiple businesses along this road are repeatedly leaving wooden pallets and commercial waste on the public pavement, causing obstruction to pedestrians. As shown in the attached photos, pallets are being stored directly on the pedestrian walkway against the building frontage. This forces pedestrians to step into the road, creating a safety risk—particularly at night and for vulnerable users such as wheelchair users, parents with prams, and the elderly. This is not an isolated incident. The issue appears ongoing and is caused by businesses using the public footway as free storage rather than arranging proper collection or on-site storage. This area has already suffered from repeated misuse by commercial operators, and residents should not have to tolerate pavements being treated as private loading bays. I am requesting enforcement action and that the responsible businesses be instructed to remove the pallets immediately and stop using the pavement for storage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Commercial Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sign has fallen down, 11th January
item.description:
Cherry Garden Street road sign has fallen down the pole. It's recently fallen half way down its pole to head height which is dangerous for pedestrians walking past. It needs to be raised back up to the top.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 154, Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
